intro: Mollinedia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered mollinedia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Mollinedia micrantha is typically found in moist, shady habitats such as forest understories and stream banks.
